hints.content:
We can take away $\pink{6}$ scoops from the $\purple{9}$ scoops $\purple{\text{Sue}}$ has to see how many scoops $\green{\text{Tessa}}$ has.

$\purple{9} - \pink{6} = \green{\Box}$

![](${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/24ff7fdff8c7b5286dac8e343fe51742.png)![](${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/bb248a1c59d95e55700e97930882ae9c.png)![](${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/d716e16f23b99f43c5dc45fa1186aa46.png)
Tessa's ice cream cone has $\green{3}$ scoops.

question.content:
Sue's ice cream cone has $6$ more scoops than Tessa's ice cream cone.

Sue's ice cream cone has $9$ scoops.

**How many scoops are on Tessa's ice cream cone?**

[[☃ input-number 1]] scoops
